conversation.thought:
As Parent_C, my goal is to secure my highest preferred nursery. My top preference is Nursery_D. I must propose to my top choice in Round 1 to maximize my chances, following the structure of the Parent-Proposing Deferred Acceptance algorithm.

Parent_C's Rank 1 choice: Nursery_D.
Nursery_D's Priority List: Parent_A, Parent_C, Parent_D, Parent_E, Parent_B. (I am ranked 2nd).

If other parents follow standard DA strategy:
Parent_A, Parent_B, and Parent_D will likely propose to Nursery_E (their top choice).
Parent_E will likely propose to Nursery_C (their top choice).

This means Nursery_D is likely to receive a proposal only from Parent_C, or potentially Parent_A if Parent_A is rejected by Nursery_E, but in Round 1, Parent_A proposes to Nursery_E. Therefore, Parent_C has a very strong chance of being accepted by Nursery_D immediately. I will submit a formal application [APPLY] to my top choice, Nursery_D.
